p: The hot plate method was performed to determine the central analgesic activity of EK extract in mice. In this model all the three test doses of EK extract and the standard drug morphine produced significant central analgesic activity (p < 0.05, p < 0.01 and p < 0.001) by delaying the reaction time at all-time intervals of observation when compared with the negative control ( Table 2). The maximum analgesic activities of all doses of the extract (100, 200 and 400 mg/kg) was observed at 120 mins of observation with the respective values of 63.93%, 66.94%, and 69.40% as compared with the standard drug (morphine 10 mg/kg) that produced 70.81% analgesic activity ( Figure 1).
